review_title: Lots of nepotism and abusing powers, and no real meaningful programs
job_title: Gender and Equity Specialist Cum Women Development Officer in Toronto, ON
pros: Good Salary good benefits and flexible hours
cons: Lots of nepotism and corruption and a lot of people there don't care about communities they are helping. They say they support queer communities and they don't hire trans people.
they should accept their employees critisim

pros: Great benefits, good work culture, supported staff during COVID-19
cons: Funding is inadequate and the HIV sector generally can't pay the highest wages.

pros: The staff was very helpful, kind, and informative.
cons: I did not experience any cons.

pros: There are absolutely NO positive reasons to work for this company! Poor pay, benefits, training, and advancement opportunities are some negative aspects of the company. Add to that, childish temper tantrums, emotional outbursts, and backstabbing from ALL levels of management.
cons: The unstable emotions and behaviors of the management can follow you through your career. Remember, you may need their reference for another job or security clearance years later, and what they say will depend on their mood when they are asked. These managers are not professional in their behavior.

pros: Generally supportive work environment, good pay, lots of very smart co-workers.
cons: Old school way of doing things in many respects, although there is a push to change at least some of these. Technical support takes weeks to get back to you sometimes. Much of the bureaucratic red tape that any large organization has.

pros: Manager pays for lunch, you can earn up to $1000 a week, your independent, and you set your own hours.
cons: Putting gas in your own vehicle, long hours, unpredictable pay, and commissions are based on how well you do.

review_title: A Top Employer in the Not-For-Profit World
pros:
- Great workplace culture
- Great benefits
- Great work/life balance
- Unionized
- Management felt engaged and interested in your well-being
cons:
- Unionized (while I support the union, it did make certain processes difficult internally)
- Very little upward mobility
- Professional development was limited

review_title: The best employer ever in the not-for-profit industry
pros: Excellent management, very organized, excellent offices, work place free of oppression

review_title: Too little pay for way too much time and work
pros: Great people work there delivering the actual services.
cons: Too much O/T expected for pay offered.  Benefits not at all as described.

pros: Great people, great experience. The best internship I have ever had. Balances work and training for full time employment.
cons: Nothing that I can think of!

pros: flexible, learning opportunity, good starter job
cons: low pay, secretive management, poor morale

pros: A lot of smart people there.
cons: Very territorial and 1980s thinking towards modern business environment.

pros: It was terrific to work with some of the staff.
cons: Lack of management for some and micro management for others.
